channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Hamas and Fatah sign declaration in Beijing on ending yearslong rift
item.description: Hamas and Fatah have signed a significant unity declaration in Beijing aimed at ending their long-standing rift and forming a government. This move comes amid ongoing Gaza conflict and international cease-fire efforts. Despite past failures at reconciliation, the agreement signals a potential shift. The future of Gaza governance remains uncertain, with Israel and the US rejecting various proposals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: King Charles 'not a monster', says former staff denying claims of his 'terrible' temper
item.description: A former employee defended King Charles against claims of being 'irascible,' describing him as 'absolutely not a monster in the office.' This comes after a video showed him irritated by a leaking pen. The staff member emphasised that, while he can be temperamental, he is well-prepared and respected. Meanwhile, Prince William’s focus is reportedly on his family, ignoring tensions with Harry and Meghan.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'This is a good sign': Netanyahu indicates possible deal for Gaza hostages nearing
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance slams Kamala Harris as ‘million times worse’ than Biden at rally
item.description: At a rally in Radford, Virginia, Republican vice-presidential nominee JD Vance slammed Vice President Kamala Harris, calling her “a million times worse” than President Biden. Vance criticised both parties for outsourcing jobs and emphasised a need to restore American manufacturing. Attendees voiced concerns over jobs, inflation, and Biden’s health, as heightened security was evident.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'With immense pride and ...': Harris wins key support for White House race after Pelosi endorses her
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 24-year-old Chinese influencer Pan Xiaoting dies during livestream Mukbang session
item.description: 24-year-old Chinese influencer Pan Xiaoting died during a Mukbang livestream on July 14. Known for consuming up to 10 kg of food in marathon sessions, she weighed 300 kg at the time of her death. Her extreme eating habits, despite family warnings, led to severe health issues. Her tragic death highlights the dangers of Mukbang and influencer pressures.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What is DNC 2024? When is it and how do delegates work; What you need to know
item.description: President Joe Biden's withdrawal from the 2024 race shifts the spotlight to Vice President Kamala Harris ahead of the Democratic National Convention (DNC) on August 19-22 in Chicago. The DNC will determine the party's presidential and vice-presidential nominees through a delegate voting process, with Harris needing to secure significant support to lead the Democratic ticket.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'You're lucky you turned to right': Biden told Trump on call after assassination attempt
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Cocaine sharks: Brazilian study shows marine predators 'high' on drug
item.description: Scientists discovered high levels of cocaine in Brazilian sharpnose sharks off Rio de Janeiro, raising concerns about behavioural impacts. The study found chronic exposure, with cocaine concentrations up to 100 times higher than in other marine animals. Potential sources include drug lab drainage or untreated sewage. This marks the first evidence of cocaine in free-ranging sharks, with further studies required.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China FM says Palestinian factions agree to set up 'reconciliation government'
item.description: Palestinian factions including Hamas and Fatah met in Beijing this week in a renewed bid for reconciliation.

item.title: Donald Trump describes Harris as 'bad combination' of 'vicious and dumb'
item.description: Donald Trump has branded Vice President Kamala Harris as 'vicious and dumb' in an interview with The Post, marking his first major comments since President Biden withdrew from the presidential race. Trump’s remarks come as Harris, the likely Democratic nominee, seeks to consolidate support. Trump’s criticisms include past controversies and Harris’s role as Biden’s 'border czar.'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israeli government quietly sends millions to unauthorized West Bank settler outposts
item.description: Documents uncovered by Peace Now illustrate how Israel's pro-settler government has quietly poured money into the unauthorized outposts, which are separate from its more than 100 officially recognized settlements. Some of those outposts have been linked to settler violence against Palestinians and are sanctioned by the US.

item.title: Thousands of migrant kids have reached the Canary Islands alone
item.description: Mora Peces is among a growing number of people sounding the alarm as the archipelago struggles to deal with thousands of teenagers and children traveling alone to the European Union territory from Senegal, Mali, and other African nations, fleeing poverty, conflict and instability.

item.title: Israeli operation in Gaza's Khan Yunis kills 70
item.description: The health ministry in Hamas-run Gaza said Monday that an Israeli operation in the main southern city of Khan Yunis killed 70 people and wounded more than 200, after Israel warned its forces would "forcefully operate" in the area. "Due to the Israeli occupation's attacks and massacres in Khan Yunis governorate from the early hours of this morning until now, 70 people have been martyred and more than 200 wounded," the Gaza health ministry said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hindu temple in Canada defaced with anti-India graffiti
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Woman calls 911 to report suspected intruder, 'shot in face' by Illinois police
item.description: Bodycam footage released by Illinois police shows the fatal shooting of Sonya Massey by a sheriff's deputy. The officer has been charged with murder and official misconduct, pleading not guilty. President Biden expresses condolences, while protests demand justice. The incident highlights ongoing issues of police violence and the need for reform.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taiwan curtails annual war games as Typhoon Gaemi barrels towards island
item.description: Gaemi, the first typhoon of the season to affect Taiwan, is expected to make landfall on the northeast coast between sometime on Wednesday night and the early hours of Thursday, according to the island's Central Weather Administration.

item.title: Astrophotographer captures stunning 236,000-mile-long solar wall of plasma
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I look forward to ...': Harris secured broad support needed to become party's nominee
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What’s the buzz about Kamala Harris' 'coconut tree' meme?
item.description: US Vice President Kamala Harris, a frontrunner for the Democratic presidential nomination, has gained momentum thanks to viral 'coconut tree' memes. These memes, originating from a May 2023 speech, have turned Harris’s quirky remarks into a social media sensation. With President Biden out, Harris's candidacy has surged, bolstered by memes, celebrity endorsements, and digital campaigns.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
